did.unittitle: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation records, Corporate Structure, RG 1

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Record Group 1, Corporate Structure, contains the Foundation's incorporation papers and files relating to the Board of Trustees. These include packets of grant-related materials for each board meeting, committee files, correspondence, manuals, and organizational charts. The meeting minutes are particularly significant to this Subgroup because they detail all the actions and decisions made by the Board of Trustees since the Foundation's inception in 1950, and the Board Books provide insight into the grant-making process after 1986.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 10 years old are open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged as follows:
Series 2: Biographical Files (See Record Group 4 for Trustee Biographical Files)

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Knight Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Knight Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The activity reports, also known as trustee packets, are prepared by the Communications Department for the trustees as informative reading before board meetings. They are a compilation of newspaper and magazine articles about Knight Foundation staff, trustees and programs as well as correspondence, including letters and notes from grantees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes coverage of programs (Knight Center for Specialized Journalism, youth violence, etc.), Larry Meyer's article re. community foundations and newspapers relationships, Knight Ridder's relocation from Miami, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes coverage of programs [Education (Communities in Schools, etc.), Community Initiatives (National Center for Family Literacy, Youth Violence), Arts & Culture (Magic of Music, Museum Loan Network, etc.), Journalism (Knight Chairs, international journalism programs), the activities of Hodding Carter, an editorial by Ben Maidenberg, Center for Specialized Journalism, youth violence, etc.), and Larry Meyer on the importance of philanthropy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes coverage of the Foundation's new IDEAS fund (NewTown Macon), programs [Education (Read, Write and Type!, etc.), Community Initiatives (National Center for Family Literacy, Youth Violence), Arts & Culture (Magic of Music, Museum Loan Network, etc.), Journalism ("American Journalism Review" AJR), the election of Ben Maidenberg to the Board of Trustees, and interviews with Hodding Carter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes coverage of programs and grantees [Education (Teach for America, Institute for School Innovation), Community Initiatives (National Center for Family Literacy, Youth Violence, NewTown Macon), Arts and Culture (Magic of Music, Ohr-O'Keefe Museum,, etc.), Journalism (Inter-American Press Assoc. funding for rapid response team in response to violence against journalists in Latin America). Also clippings re. Penny McPhee, Linda Raybin, opening of James L. Knight International Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a memo from Larry Meyer re: a sample electronic summary of recent coverage available online. Printed newsclips are being phased out. This packet includes a list of online articles and reprints re: donor-advised funds, community foundations and recent grants.

did.unittitle: Administrative and Human Resources/Human Resources and Administrative

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The name of the committee was changed to "Administrative and Human Resources" in 1998. Staffing, benefits, organizational structure, and policies and procedures are some of the concerns addressed by this committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Meeting materials for the Human Resources and Administrative Committee Meeting (also includes materials for the Finance Committee Meeting), held on 12/8/97 in Miami, FL. Materials include the minutes of the Human Resources and Administrative Committee meeting of 9/15/97, Admin./HR activities update and agenda for 1998, 1997/1998 Administrative Expense Budgets, 403 (b) Distribution Discussion, 1997/1998 Program Initiatives. Also included are the materials for the Finance Committee of 12/8/97.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Agenda and minutes of the quarterly meeting of the Human Resources and Administrative Committee. Includes updates re. benefits, recruitment, Archives and document management, and the John S. Knight Papers at the University of Akron. Also contains a Board of Trustees resolution concerning the Archives and Document Management Policy.

Also contains a Board of Trustees resolution concerning the Archives and Document Management Policy.

did.unittitle: National Venture Fund - Immigration Strategy Review, Background Information for Conference Call

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Background materials for a Grants Review Committee and Planning Committee conference call, April 30, 2004. The materials lay out the case for Knight Foundation to launch a five-year project to address opportunities brought about by massive immigration flows. The project would be supported through the National Venture Fund. Background materials include: national immigration trends; immigration integration and civic participation strategy; logic model; proposed grant summaries; headlines from Knight Communities and supplemental materials.

Also included are the background materials distributed prior to the meeting, including reports, proposals and grants for discussion.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The sub-committee, consisting of chair Michael Maness, Juan Martinez, Ben Wirz and trustees Joi Ito, Chris Hughes and John Palfrey, have met several times beginning in the spring of 2012 to establish the framework for this new sub-committee which seeks to find for-profit ventures for KF to invest in. KF total budget for these type of investments is $10 million. The sub-committee approved a $100,000 investment in UMBEL, which helps publishers gain a clear picture of exactly who their digital audience is and what affinities, interets and behaviors they have. Exactly how an Enterprise Fund will work at KF is being worked out by the sub-committee. In addition to minutes of several meetings, other materials are: a memo from Ben Wirz re: Program Related Investment Profile for Daily Feats, an online network that helps people reach their personal goals; sub-committee structure and organization as of April 3, 2012; and charts outlining the Knight Enterprise Fund Portfolio, as of April 2012.

Officers: Chairman - Robert Briggs, Vice-Chair, Cesar Alvarez; plus two new officers: Vice President/Journalism and Media Innovation: Michael Maness and Vice President/Strategy and Assessment: Mayur Patel. The nominating committee recommends expanding the number of trustees temporarily in 2011 from 15 to 17 because 4 trustees will be going off the board in 2012. Also included are background materials sent to committee members in advance of the meeting, consisting of the nominating committee report to the Board; a chart listing trustee names, birth dates, year voted to board, trustee class and year retiring; and trustee area of expertise; meeting dates for 2011-2012 and trustee compensation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Nominating Committee minutes re: personal interviews with four candidates for the board. The committee, based on the board resolution of 9/12/11 to allow the temporary increase in the number of trustees, recommends eight new trustees. Each new trustee is elected to different, short terms of one, two, or three years, after which he or she is eligible to be elected up to two, six -year terms. (March 2012: Borges, Considine, Kronick; March 2013: Hughes, Ito, Nelson; March 2014: Bell-Rose, Palfrey).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records in these files contain memos to trustees regarding pending grant requests. Many of the memos, dating between 1967 and 1971 are early versions of write-ups. There is correspondence with Barbara knight Toomey about her election to the Board in 1980, correspondence regarding portraits of the Knight brothers (1986), memos about emergency grants (1990), Kids Voting (1991), correspondence with Jill Conway on her election to the Board and ideas on its direction (1994), and memos on the election of Marjorie Knight Crane to the Board, and trustee compensation (1994). Also included is John Ong correspondence (1995-1997). Lee Hills' retirement as Chairman (1996), Alvah Chapman's correspondence regarding KRI stock sales and Knight Foundation policies (1997), general Board correspondence (1999) and a copy of a letter from President George W. Bush to the Knight Foundation commending its contribution to relief efforts for Hurricane Katrina (2005).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The first manual for trustees was created on September 29, 1995. It includes Board of Trustees membership lists and biographies, information on committees, and meetings, procedures for Trustee Discretionary Grants, compensation and reimbursements of expenses, as well as information about the Foundation (Advisory Committees, statement of purpose and history, the articles of incorporation, code of regulations, policies and insurance, budget information, and its ranking with other foundations) and its staff. The manual is updated approximately every two years.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manual includes sections on Board of Trustees (members, biographies, committees and meetings), Advisory Committees (guidelines, Education, Journalism, Community Initiatives, Athletics Commission, "Magic of Music" Symphony Orchestra Initiative, Foundation Staff, Statement of Purpose and History, Articles of Incorporation and Code of Regulations, Policies (indemnification, liability insurance and conflict of interest), Compensation and Reimbursement of Expenses, Trustee Discretionary Grant Procedures, Associations to Which Knight Foundation Belongs and Subscriptions to Publications for Trustees, Budget, and General Information (Financial Data and Rankings of Foundations).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manual includes sections on Board of Trustees (members, biographies, committees and meetings), Advisory Committees membership lists, background on Foundation (staff, organizational chart, Statement of Purpose and History, Articles of Incorporation and Code of Regulations), information about policies and compensation, and grant procedures, the budget, and general information (financial data and rankings of foundations).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The board meeting agendas, spanning from 1966 to 1973, contain general information about the topics covered during the meeting, as well as grant write-ups and recommendations. After 1973, the agenda is an outline of meeting topics. Beginning in June 1992, the agendas are included in the Board Books (See Subgroup 1, Board of Trustees Meetings, Board Books). Starting again in 2003, the agendas are treated as separate documents. Also included is a list of meeting dates and committee assignments (1991-2002).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Board Books are preparatory materials sent to trustees before a board meeting and include the agenda (after June 1992), a summary of the grant commitments for the year, staff rejections, a summary of the pending proposals, and the grant write-ups. The write-up for each grant consists of the proposal and recommendations by advisors and, until 1992, the Distribution Committee. The Board Books also may contain copies of the Board resolutions. Grant write-ups dating 1971-1986 can be found in the Lee Hills Papers (see Record Group 3). The write-ups will be found under "Trustees Meetings" In the alphabetical scheme.

scopecontent.p: Contains advanced materials sent to trustees for the September 14, 2008 board meeting. Includes a memo from Alberto Ibarguen re: KF Performance Survey which contains summary information from the CEP (Center for Effective Philanthropy) and Bendixen surveys, community by community; a memo from Paula Ellis re: Gallup Soul of the Community survey, "a groundbreaking look at the emotional attachment of residents in 26 Knight communities where they live"; an article, "What is social media? An ebook from iCrossing" which explains digital media applications; and a PowerPoint presentation, "South Florida Regional Public Broadcasting Operation" due diligence report prepared by KF consultant Deron Triff, which examines the possibility of a merger of the two South Florida PBS stations. NOTE: Ellis memo found to be missing February 2009 by LCP.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The minutes are a complete record of the discussions and actions of the Board of Trustees at their quarterly meetings. Grant proposals are voted on, and the general business of the Foundation is discussed, including appointments of board committee members. The minutes also contain an abridged version of the Treasurer's Report (after 1962), as resolutions. A resolution of the Board changed the name of the Knight Foundation to the James S. and James L. Knight Foundation in September 1992. The resolution became effective on January 1, 1993.

Items for discussion include: reports by the Finance Committee, Pension Committee, Treasurer, Administrative and Human Resources Committee, the President (Hodding Carter joins foundation as president), the Distribution Committee (list of approved grants included), Nominating Committee, the Chairman, and the Planning and Program Committee, a Resolution for Archive and Document Management Policy (March), a Trustee List, 1998 Committee Appointments, a Resolution and Recommendations from the Planning Committee for Operating in Communities Without Advisors, a Memorandum from General Counsel on Community Initiatives Funding in Knight Ridder Cities, and an Attachment from General Counsel on Self-dealing Issues and Knight Foundation's Relationship with Knight Ridder (June). Eleven original Knight Communities/cities. 2 folders

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Resolution on naming structures after the Knight Brothers only. Conflict of Interest Policy Memo from Rod Petrey.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Issues regarding the 401K plan, matching contributions and pension plans were discussed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

The Administrative and Human Resources Committee Chair, John Ong, reported on a number of administrative and staffing issues. Also included is the President's Report, a review of grants approved, and a copy of the Strategic Plan, 2000 - 2005. The June minutes report on a special meeting (to consider South Florida grants) and a regular quarterly meeting, both held in Miami, on June 11th and 12th, respectively. Included is an update on the implementation of the Community Partners Program, a Program Initiative Expense Summary, an administrative budget report, and a grant spending analysis.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Incorporation Papers of the Knight Foundation are organized into three series: Amendments, Articles of Incorporation, and By-Laws. The Foundation's original Articles of Incorporation, dated December 28, 1950, named it the "Knight Foundation: and charged it with the responsibility of receiving and administering funds "all of which shall be directly or indirectly for the benefit of the general public." An additional purpose of the Knight Foundation was to take over and carry out what was here-to-fore known as the Knight Memorial Education Fund. The Amended and Restated Articles of Incorporation of Knight foundation were written in 1987. The Amendments include a "Certificate of Amendment to Articles of Incorporation of Knight Foundation" (12/29/71), and the By-laws contain a "Code of Regulations" (1997), "By-laws of the Trustees and Code of Regulations with Amendments" (1978), and an "Amended Code of Regulations of Knight Foundation" (1987). Other revisions to the by-laws are included.The minutes from the first meeting of the Board of Trustees on December 29, 1950, also include the Foundation's Articles of Incorporation, By-Laws, and Amendments from later years, which were continually added to this subseries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Certificate of Amendment to Articles of Incorporation of Knight Foundation (IRS determination)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memos and forms re: dealings with the Internal Revenue Service. Issues concerned recognition of the Knight Foundation as a 501(c)(3) tax exempt organization; rulings on issues arriving from settlement of the estate of John S. Knight and merger of the Ohio and Florida corporations. A completed IRS Form 1023 "Application for Recognition of Exemption" is included.
